links.label: Weird JavaScript
links.info: This shouldn't work, but it does. (Source Writing a sentence without using the alphabet.)

questions:
Found online: There are two meanings for {}: an object or a block. This is a problem for arrow functions that return an object. In order to differentiate between a code block, we need to use () => ({}) to return an object. 
(n) => {n}   // undefined
(n) => ({n}) // object
Check out the !!LINK 0!!! It's got animations, custom cursors, and a whole lotta ü•ß and üç∞. <small>Plus, it's fully accessible... (HINT: Turn on NVDA.)</small>
